channel.title: Woodmont Industrial News Feed
channel.description: Daily industrial and CRE updates across key regions - categorized by Relevant Articles, Transactions, Availabilities, and People News

item.title: Investor Duo Sells Avondale USPS Distribution Center for $89.8M
item.description: Westfield and RGA ReCap offloaded the Fairway Commerce Center in Avondale, a 450,000 square foot distribution center. The $89.8 million sale features a 10-year triple-net lease with the United States Postal Service. It represents one of the most significant industrial transactions in the West Valley submarket this year, according to JLL, which represented RGA. Invesco ... The post Investor Duo Sells Avondale USPS Distribution Center for $89.8M appeared first on Connect CRE .
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Mike Boyd

item.title: Giant closing fulfillment centers as it adjusts ecommerce operations
item.description: Giant will close its Coopersburg and other PA fulfillment centers as it shifts to store-based picking and third-party delivery to offer faster ecommerce service.

item.author: Stacy Wescoe

item.description: Pennsylvania home prices rose 5.2% in November while sales dipped and inventory grew slightly, according to the latest report from the Pennsylvania Association of Realtors.

item.title: In memoriam 2025: Remembering those we lost in New Jersey commercial real estate
item.description: We said goodbye in 2025 to several key figures in New Jersey’s commercial real estate community. Some were industry icons whose careers spanned more than half a century, but all were remembered by colleagues as valued friends and team members. Here is a look back at our coverage and the tributes that poured in from across the industry.

item.title: Union Pacific’s Rosenberg Warehouse Project Could Top 20M SF
item.description: Union Pacific Railroad is developing a 2,000-acre, master-planned industrial park in Rosenberg, Texas. Mainline Texas Industrial Park has the potential to total 20 million square feet. Commercial Edge reports 1,300 acres will be Union Pacific rail-accessible, while 700 acres will instead target non-rail industrial and commercial tenants. The property will also include up to 1,700 ... The post Union Pacific’s Rosenberg Warehouse Project Could Top 20M SF appeared first on Connect CRE .

item.title: Forman Arranges Construction Loan for Houston Retail Center
item.description: Forman Capital closed a $37.1 million construction loan for the development of The Oaks of District West, a new open-air retail, restaurant and entertainment destination in the Richmond submarket of the Houston MSA. The project is being developed by Ferguson Family Partners and is located at 21711 FM-1093, Richmond, Texas. The Oaks of District West will feature approximately 87,244 ... item.description: Mesirow Financial acquired Riachi at One21, a 450-unit multifamily property in Plano. Banner Real Estate Group sold the asset. item.title: Greystone Provides $36.6M Refi for Vintage Houston Apartments
item.description: Greystone provided a $36.6 million Freddie Mac loan to refinance a 476-unit garden-style multifamily community located in Houston, Texas. Located at 4010 Linkwood Drive, Houston, The Stratford House was developed in 1966. The property offers renovated apartments and townhomes with one-, two- and three-bedroom layouts. The Freddie Mac loan carries a fixed 5-year term and features ... The post Greystone Provides $36.6M Refi for Vintage Houston Apartments appeared first on Connect CRE .

item.title: Keating Buys Shuttered 1M-SF Waco Glass Plant
item.description: Keating Resources has purchased a 1,060,000 square foot manufacturing and distribution building located on 56 acres of Interstate 35 in Waco. The seller was Owens-Illinois, who has a glass plant at the location between 1943 and 2023. Alec Keating, President of Keating Resources, said the company is repositioning the 907,000 square foot distribution portion of ... item.title: Stream Closes on Recap for 7 Texas Industrial Properties
item.description: Stream Realty Partners closed on the recapitalization of a portfolio of seven Class A industrial assets in Texas.  The industrial parks were developed by Stream and a foreign investor from 2021 to 2024 and comprise 4.4 million square feet of Class A industrial space catering to a variety of modern industrial users. The buildings offer flexible footprints from 25,000 square feet of shallow ... The post Stream Closes on Recap for 7 Texas Industrial Properties appeared first on Connect CRE .
